required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of Pharmacokinetics of Levetiracetam in Patients Undergoing Intermittent Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: The Study of Pharmacokinetics of Levetiracetam in Patients Undergoing Intermittent Hemodialysis

lead_sponsor.agency: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Levetiracetam (LEV) is one of second-generation antiepileptic drugs that has been used to treat partial and generalized epilepsy. LEV is eliminated from the systemic circulation by renal excretion. Therefore, patients with renal impairment may experience a reduced drug excretion and increased adverse drug reactions. Moreover, patients with end-stage renal disease who need dialysis may experience low serum LEV concentration because of drug loss via dialysis. LEV loss via dialysis can cause low serum level of LEV that insufficient for seizure control. The present study was aimed to evaluate pharmacokinetics of LEV in patients undergoing 4 hour-intermittent hemodialysis (IHD). The results of the study may benefit to determine the appropriate LEV initial dose and supplemental dose for patients undergoing IHD.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before an initiation of an intermittent hemodialysis session
primary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on dialysis day

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour after an initiation of an intermittent hemodialysis session
primary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on dialysis day

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hour after an initiation of an intermittent hemodialysis session
primary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on dialysis day

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hour after an initiation of an intermittent hemodialysis session
primary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on dialysis day

primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 hour after an initiation of an intermittent hemodialysis session
primary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on dialysis day

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before an administration of Levetiracetam post-hemodialysis supplemental dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on dialysis day

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour after finishing an administration of Levetiracetam post-hemodialysis supplemental dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on dialysis day

secondary_outcome.description: Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on non-dialysis day.
Measured Levetiracetam plasma concentration (mcg/mL) of the subjects on non-dialysis day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse drug reactions from Levetiracetam
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first day that participants were included to the study and treated with Levetiracetam until the date of the last point of serum Levetiracetam sampling, assessed up to 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Observed signs and symptoms of Levetiracetam adverse drug reactions after participants were administered with Levetiracetam.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who were admitted to Phramongkutklao Hospital as inpatients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who were at least 18 years old.
2. Patients who were diagnosed with seizure.
3. Patients who were undergoing intermittent hemodialysis and were treated with intravenous Levetiracetam not less than 2 days
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who were pregnant or lactating
2. Patients who were treated with intravenous Levetiracetam more than once a day
3. Patients who were undergoing sustained low efficiency dialysis (SLED)
4. Patients who have intermittent dialysis duration less than 3 hours

overall_official.affiliation: Pharmongkutklao Hospital and College of Medicine
The College of Pharmacotherapy of Thailand
